articles.title: GRDC Update: Pulses a ‘slow burn’ as WA seeks wider rotation
articles.summary: Despite their volatile markets and agronomic and harvesting challenges, pulses are piquing interest among WA growers, as evidenced in two GRDC Perth Update sessions this week.

articles.title: Wilga Farming expands Great Southern footprint
articles.summary: Investor Wilga Farming has expanded its holdings in WA's Great Southern region to take in Que Sera and part of the WALT Portfolio.

articles.title: Large CQ area set to underpin national mungbean crop
articles.summary: Recent rain means CQ is on track to produce much of Australia's mungbean crop, and growers are advised to take extra care not to exceed MRLs.

articles.title: District farmers buy Boorala, Wilgaroi, Kookaburragong
articles.summary: Family farmers are showing an appetite for local expansion, as evidenced by the sales of Boorala in SA, and Wilgaroi and Kookaburragong in NSW.

articles.title: GrainCorp confident of global market rebalance
articles.summary: GrainCorp executives say they expect a more balanced global market to emerge, as the company continues to contend with grain oversupply and sustained price pressures.

articles.title: Feedgrain Focus: Qld rain brightens new-crop prospects
articles.summary: Substantial rain over parts of the Qld grainbelt has been welcomed, falling at the ideal time for recently planted sorghum in CQ, and topping up subsoil ahead of winter-crop planting.

articles.title: Daily Market Wire 20 February 2026
articles.summary: Wheat rallies 2 percent amid technical breakout; sentiment dominates price action.

articles.title: GRDC Update: Satellites reveal crunch times for frost
articles.summary: A CSIRO project is using Himawari satellite imagery coupled with APSIM modelling to predict in-crop wheat, barley, canola, chickpea and lentil yield losses to frost.

articles.title: Ag Minister rejects GPA levy proposal
articles.summary: Agriculture Minister Collins has knocked back changes to the levy system proposed by GPA, pointing to a lack of widespread support across the sector.

articles.title: Spraying to control bacteria shows promise in curbing frost hits
articles.summary: WA DPIRD research shows frost impact can be mitigated by spraying oxide-based formulations on ice-nucleating bacteria found on senesced wheat and barley leaves.

articles.title: Resurrect Bio raises $8.1m to unlock plants’ innate disease resistance capabilities
articles.summary:
Resurrect Bio helps plants unlock innate capabilities to fight disease without chemical inputs.

The post Resurrect Bio raises $8.1m to unlock plants’ innate disease resistance capabilities appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: AgriFood Signals: Egypt eGrocer Breadfast banks $50m, Kubota invests in spray ‘bot, Trump’s glyphosate order
articles.summary:
Plus: Cargill's latest alt-chocolate foray.

The post AgriFood Signals: Egypt eGrocer Breadfast banks $50m, Kubota invests in spray ‘bot, Trump’s glyphosate order appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: Ruminant BioTech eyes Canada as launchpad for global expansion with $5.6m research program
articles.summary:
Feed additives suit intensive farming systems, but a longer-lasting solution for methane reduction is needed for pasture-raised cattle, says Ruminant BioTech.

The post Ruminant BioTech eyes Canada as launchpad for global expansion with $5.6m research program appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: From rocks to row crops, TerraClear broadens its capabilities with launch of fully autonomous robot
articles.summary:
TerraClear aims to make precision farming "technically and economically feasible" for growers with the launch of its TerraScout robot.

The post From rocks to row crops, TerraClear broadens its capabilities with launch of fully autonomous robot appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: Hybrid meat for the win: JOYN Foods finds sweet spot in alt-protein market, expects to be EDITDA positive in early 2027
articles.summary:
JOYN Foods expects to triple revenues in 2026 and then triple them again in 2027, driven by rapid growth in foodservice markets.

The post Hybrid meat for the win: JOYN Foods finds sweet spot in alt-protein market, expects to be EDITDA positive in early 2027 appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: US receiver to liquidate Believer Meats’ factory and assets as Israeli trustee ringfences IP
articles.summary:
Creditors Gray Construction and Ameris Bank have positioned themselves to be first in line as Believer's US assets are sold.

The post US receiver to liquidate Believer Meats’ factory and assets as Israeli trustee ringfences IP appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: AI in India: The world’s ‘AI back office’ is betting on small language models to bring big impact to smallholder farming
articles.summary:
The real victory won't be in the size of the model, but in the ability to finally make it work for the person in the field.

The post AI in India: The world’s ‘AI back office’ is betting on small language models to bring big impact to smallholder farming appeared first on AgFunderN

articles.title: Alt-coffee startup Koppie nets new funds to build 1,000-ton capacity for launch partners in 2026
articles.summary:
While several alt-coffee startups are now pitching to big coffee companies, the fact Koppie has a single ingredient and can slot into existing downstream coffee infrastructure can potentially give it an edge, claims the firm.

The post Alt-coffee startup Koppie nets new funds to build 1,000-ton capacity for launch partners in 2026 appeared first on

articles.title: Guest article: Separating the wheat from the chaff in agtech
articles.summary:
The next winners in agtech will "solve real problems for real farmers," backed by patient, operationally savvy capital, says Rob Appleby.

The post Guest article: Separating the wheat from the chaff in agtech appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: India will see IPOs in agritech before America or Europe, says Omnivore’s Mark Kahn
articles.summary:
"Even though India is a smallholder ecosystem, it is one of the largest agricultural economies in the world," says Omnivore's Mark Kahn.

The post India will see IPOs in agritech before America or Europe, says Omnivore’s Mark Kahn appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: As climate shocks hit Kenya, GrowPact bets on seedlings, greenhouses, and tech
articles.summary:
Though its core mission remains seedling production, GrowPact has since expanded its scope of services by offering farmers inputs including fertilizer, chemicals, and drip lines.

The post As climate shocks hit Kenya, GrowPact bets on seedlings, greenhouses, and tech appeared first on AgFunderNews.

articles.title: New Adir Power platform for transport and applications in orchards and vineyards
articles.summary: Ant Robotics has launched the Adir Power, a new heavy-duty mobile robot platform aimed at transportation and maintenance tasks.

articles.title: Kubota leads €6.5 million funding round in ultra-precise spot spraying robot developer Kilter
articles.summary: Kubota Corporation has led a €6.5 million pre-Series B investment round in Norwegian AgTech start-up Kilter AS, developer of the autonomous AX-1 ultra-precise spot spraying robot for high-value crops. The funding round also included existing investors SBG Invest AS, Pymwymic and Nufarm. Alongside the investment, Kubota and Kilter announced a distribution partnership that will make the […]

articles.title: Is an AI chatbot reliable as a workplace assistant?
articles.summary: AI, short for artificial intelligence, is now an integral part of agriculture—from crop recognition and the automatic adjustment of harvesters to sorting potatoes and tulips. AI is also increasingly being consulted in the workplace. A “smart” chatbot seems like an easy search engine, but is it actually reliable? The answer to whether an AI chatbot […]

articles.title: Ant Robotics introduces autonomous platform Valera Cube
articles.summary: Ant Robotics has introduced the Valera Cube, an autonomous tool carrier designed for operations in polytunnels, vineyards, tabletops, and field crops. The robot is positioned as a flexible plant protection and crop care solution for high-value horticultural crops such as strawberries, raspberries, grapes, and tomatoes but can also be used in field crops such as […]

articles.title: Autonomy as a strategy – Why a Dutch bulb grower invested in a driverless tractor
articles.summary: For Stef Ruiter, autonomy is not about replacing labour. It is about timing, soil health and long-term resilience. After testing a New Holland tractor equipped with the iQuus autonomous system under the Dutch NPPL programme, the tulip grower from Andijk, the Netherlands, decided to invest. Since 2019, Ruiter-Wever has been a participant in the NPPL […]

articles.title: Caterra launches fully autonomous laser weeding robot Honeybee
articles.summary: Swiss company Caterra AG has recently launched the Honeybee, a fully autonomous electric weeding robot designed to replace labour-intensive hand weeding in organic and high-value vegetable crops. With laser-based weed control and 24-hour operation capability, the company positions Honeybee as a scalable alternative to manual labour and chemical inputs. The Honeybee removes weeds using high-precision […]
